title: Manly Sea Eagles star Martin Taupau marries partner Michelle Baillie in Samoa
text:
NRL star Martin Taupau jetted overseas after his season ended to marry his long-term partner Michelle Baillie.

The couple decided on a ceremony in Taupau's home of Samoa, at the luxurious Taumeasina Island Resort surrounded by 150 loved ones.

'It was the most magical moment of my life to be in Samoa with our children and our family and friends while I married the love of my life,' the Manly Sea Eagles prop told Confidential.

Manly Sea Eagles star Martin Taupau jetted overseas after his season ended to marry his long-term partner, Michelle Baillie

The couple decided on a ceremony in Taupau's home of Samoa, at the luxurious Taumeasina Island Resort surrounded by 150 loved ones

The 29-year-old and his new wife, who is a community relations manager with the NRL, are spending time in Samoa with family after their nuptials.

'There is nothing more important to me than my wife, my family and my culture,' the Manly prop said.

'So much gratitude to those who travelled from far to join us and everyone who made our dream wedding a reality.'

The 29-year-old and his new wife, who is a community relations manager with the NRL, are spending time in Samoa with family after their nuptials

Ms Baillie and Taupau both have two children each from separate relationships.

'I wish I could find the words to describe how I was feeling on my way to walk down the aisle,' she said on Instagram days later.

Taupau was also gushing on social media, posting an adoring wedding photo with the caption: 'Of course I DO!!'' after declaring 'I will love you forever' days earlier.

Some of Taupau’s Manly teammates attended the ceremony, as did NRL executives and Grant Trouville, the league's lead photographer who also doubled as the photographer at the wedding.

Kelepi Tanginoa and former rugby league player Joe Gulavao were two famous guests, with the latter's wife, Maybelle, asked to perform at the ceremony.

The wedding tops off a great year for the NRL hardman, who recently inked a new deal with his club to extend his contract until the end of 2022.
description: The couple decided on a ceremony in Taupau's home of Samoa, at the luxurious Taumeasina Island Resort surrounded by 150 loved ones.
authors: Brittany Chain For Daily Mail Australia
